page.title: 16Farming
page.content: Treloweth Farm St.Erth. The farmer owns a complete set of annuals concerned with the family histories of Guernsey cattle going back to the last century, each cow is numbered and named based on l6 names e.g.Harebell lOO. Fields not being used by the cattle are used to grow food for the animals in the winter time,for instance stubble turnip where the cattle are allowed no more than 2O minutes "strip grazing" per day. Owing to the fact that it is very high in protein, also kale is grown. Only one herdsman is employed with the milking taking place twice daily in an 8x8 2 level abreast milking parlour. Shooting pheasant is a sport in the area and young pheasant are reared on the farm from eggs.
